post.subject: Aakash tablets on loan for CL 692
post.message: Every student of CL-692 will get one Aakash tablet, with lectures pre-loaded.  We hope to distribute this on Wednesday between 12:30 to 13:30 and in the evening 5 to 6pm.  The tablets have to be returned at the end of the semester.

discussion.name: Ask your questions one day before

post.subject: Ask your questions one day before
post.message:
Dear All,


You should post your questions the day before the lecture.  I would want it to be completed by the midnight, when the LAN ban comes into force.  For those who have access to internet, the deadline is "extended" till 6am (yes, at 6 in the morning) on the day of the lecture.  Please note that there can be no extension to the extension, whatever may be the reason.

 

This will ensure that you don't ask a question in the last minute, just for the sake of asking a question.

 

This will also give sufficient time for everyone to participate in the discussions, which is the main objective of this activity itself.


Finally, this will take care of problems, such as, Moodle not working in the last minute, etc.

post.subject: Re: Ask your questions one day before
post.message: I notice that Moodle was down last night also.  In view of this, I give an extension: can you please post your questions ASAP?  Thanks.

post.subject: Re: Ask your questions one day before
post.message:
When you post your question, can you please change your subject to slide number?  For example, you can say something like,


Slide 3: Tustin Approximation

 

This will help organise the discussion better.  It will also help understand the questions better.

discussion.name: Post your questions on Moodle - not by email

post.subject: Post your questions on Moodle - not by email
post.message:
Some of you have sent your questions through email.  Please note that you have to post your questions in Moodle only.  If you post your question early, there is no need to worry about Moodle working or not working.

 

Can those who sent my questions on Z-transform through email please re-post their questions on the forum?

discussion.name: Please post your photo on Moodle

post.subject: Please post your photo on Moodle
post.message: Please post your photo on Moodle.  A passport photo will be preferable, but any photo with good clarity should also be acceptable.

post.subject: Proxy settings for Aakash app
post.message:
Dear Sir

As discussed after the class, I am posting my question here.

There is option for setting proxy settings for browser, and hence I am able to access internet using browser. But there is no option for setting proxy settings for apps and hence no app is able to access wifi and are not running.

Can you please post the solution for this problem

post.subject: Re: Proxy settings for Aakash app
post.message:
I am posting a reply given by our Aakash expert, Srikant:

-------- Original Message --------
Subject:     Re: [Fwd: CL 692-2012-2: Proxy settings for Aakash app]
Date:     Fri, 25 Jan 2013 09:38:22 +0530
From:     Srikant <u.srikant.patnaik@gmail.com>
To:     Kannan Moudgalya <kannan@iitb.ac.in>
CC:     sachin patil <iclcoolster@gmail.com>, shubhamgupta@iitb.ac.in
References:     <5101E1AA.5050404@iitb.ac.in>



Deas Shubham,

This is a problem with android. I will suggest two solutions. Download this opensource app
ProxyDroid from here <http://www.appszoom.com/android_applications/communication/proxydroid_xtmc_download.html> and try your luck. There many such proxy authentication apps on Google play too, to try those you should connect to some direct internet source using 3G/2G dongle or wifi hotspot from any compatible phone.

Second solution is bit complex.

In a GNU/Linux machine(assuming its IP to be 192.168.1.2) install squid3 proxy server(say on your laptop)

Then open */etc/squid3/squid.conf* file as sudo and add these lines at the end of the file after updating *username:password *field.

*http_port hostmachine-ip:3128
cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/username:password/
# No direct access
never_direct allow all

*Save and close the above file. Restart the squid3 sever by
*sudo service squid3 restart*

Now connect your aakash to a wifi, long press on connected wifi and select *modify network, *Then enable *Show advance options* *-> Proxy settings (select manual)
*Add your squid3 server's detail here
*Proxy hostname *192.168.1.2
*Proxy port *3128
*Bypass proxy for *iitb.ac.in <http://iitb.ac.in>, 127.0.0.1, localhost      (*.iitb.ac.in <http://iitb.ac.in> will not work)

Then add your static IP/Gateway/DNS as usual, and for
*Network prefix* give 16 (if your subnet mask is 255.255.0.0, if not sure search your value from net)

Save settings, disable and enable wifi to make it work.
Your gmail may not work properly but this will set internet system wide. The only disadvantage is you need to engage a machine to use this feature.

Srikant

post.subject: Re: Proxy settings for Aakash app
post.message:
Sir,

If I may, I would like to point out that many of the users have special characters in their username/password. For them a small hack is to use URL escape characters in their settings. i.e. when configuring this line :

cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/username:password/

suppose username is arka and password is @rk@,

then the config line would be:

cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/arka:%40rk%40/


For a comprehensive list of URL escape characters one could refer to:

http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp

Thanks!

Arka.

post.subject: Re: Lecture on Monday - Lab 1
post.message: sir, scilab seems to have  limited functions for handling control system problems. many times computer hangs , the error messages are also not displayed . can we switch to matlab?

post.subject: Re: Lecture on Monday - Lab 1
post.message:
Absolutely not.  Your observation about Scilab is totally incorrect.  Do you know that that all the calculations required to launch the Arianne rockets have been done using Scilab?  If Arianne rockets that have placed many of our satellites are based on Scilab, it is sufficiently good enough for us.
We will see if we can give a link to my talk that explains why we should NOT use Matlab.  You shall use only Scilab in this course.

post.subject: Re: Lecture on Monday - Lab 1
post.message: Not able to resolv  code dependencies. For example,  the executing the code 'ball_basic.sce' as mentioned in 'DigitalControl' book gives the error 'sort - undefined'

post.subject: Re: Lecture on Monday - Lab 1
post.message:
Please use gsort() as sort() is obsolete in higher versions of scilab.

also note, for gsort() the default way of arranging is by decreasing order of magnitude. Please refer to scilab help for more info.

Rakhi

post.subject: Re: First Lab
post.message:
Yes, as I announced in the class, the deadline is shifted to Tuesday, 26 Feb. 2013 at 11:55 PM (i.e., midnight).  You are urged to complete your experiments, Scilab based problem solving, etc., well ahead of time and to submit by this deadline. 

Keeping the uncertainties in Internet, connectivity, Moodle, etc., there is also a one day "EXTENSION", so that the extended deadline is Wednesday, 27 Feb. 2013 at 11:55 PM (i.e., midnight).  Please note that the submission time will not be futher extended for ANY reason.  This is a hard deadline.  There can be no extension on extension!  In order that you do not get stuck with the problem of Moodle/Internet failing in the last minute, please upload at least one working version well before the deadline and keep improving it.

Submissions have to be made only through Moodle.  Files sent to email addresses will NOT be considered.

Please also make a note of our departmental policy: FR grade to be given to people who use unfair means in assignments, labs, projects, quiz, and, of course, exams.

Please note that Matlab based solution is not acceptable and will result in zero marks.  If anyone needs help with Scilab training, please let us know and we can make arrangements.  The deadlines will not be changed because of this, however.

post.subject: Discussion on Mid Semester Exam
post.message:
Some students told me that they solved 1(a) of the first problem by step response approximation and then wrote an one line answer each for 1(b) and 1(c) saying that the answer will be the same.

In the class, the discussion on this topic ended inconclusively.  I told you that we need to look for a reference that will "prove" that statement.  I also mentioned that it would be worthwhile checking this statement with some more examples.  Finally, in the exam paper, I had assigned 16 marks for 1(b) and 1(c) together - please don't expect me to assign 16 marks for one line statement.  Also, I had mentioned that we would provide help for those who wanted to calculate exponential of a matrix.  Please note that if there is a method to avoid a particular difficult calculation, I will not offer that help.

I hope that at least some of you solved 1b and 1c.

post.subject: Re: Discussion on Mid Semester Exam
post.message:
The same students mentioned that as they expected the paper to be conceptual and short (as I mentioned in the class), they thought that a one line answer was sufficient for 1b and 1c.

Here, I want to comment on the length of an open book exam.  The length of an open book will necessarily have to be different from that of a closed book exam.  Otherwise, there is a risk of some students not studying for the exam at all, hoping that they can "figure out" during the exam time.  Any amount of time provided for such students will be insufficient.

post.subject: slide 3
post.message:
In this method are we going to cancel the effect of noise on output (assuming that output depends on past values of noise signal, say 10 samples- degree of C polynomial is 10, and there is delay of 5 samples in input output relation-k=-10) , by taking suitable control action?.

I think this method works only if the delay (K) is less than the degree of the C polynomial. What is your opinion?

post.subject: Second Lab Doubts
post.message:
Implementation on SBHS


Based on the data collected in Part 1, I modelled the system and created a pole placement controller. Simulation of the controller on the transfer function with Xcos works correctly. But, I am not able to apply the controller on SBHS.


Approach: I modified the steptest.sci file. The function steptest now returns the temperature along with other variables. I feed the temperature back in the loop to the controller.

Problem: The function steptest is showing errors "algebraic loop" when I put it with same clock as the controller. When I delay the controller by 1 second, the function does not give any output.

post.subject: Re: Second Lab Doubts
post.message:
Hello Amol,

The Algedric loop error occurs because the feedback has no delay factor and hence is expected at the input instantenously. This error can be avoided by adding a very small delay factor in the feedback loop (explore the palette browser of Xcos to get the delay block). The inroduction of this delay factor may however affect the performance and one should be aware of it.

The other way of clossing the loop is by directly writing the control law in the steptest.sci file. This is the easiest approach since you already have the heat, fan and temperature variables available.

Rupak

post.subject: Quiz marks
post.message:
Quiz marks (until Quiz 16) have been uploaded. You may cross check them and report issues, if any. The marks for Quiz 17 - 20 will be uploaded soon.

Rakhi

post.subject: Re: Quiz marks
post.message:
Marks of all quizzes have now been uploaded. Please have a look. Those of you who have not collected quiz papers can collect them from me (at Automation Lab, Second Floor, Chem Engg Dept)  today from 5:00 -5:30 pm or tomorrow 12:30 - 1:00 pm.

Rakhi

post.subject: Returning of Aakash tablets
post.message:
Dear students

We will collect the Aakash tablets on 02-05-2013. So Please bring it along with you to the venue of CL 692 end sem exam.

Rakhi

post.subject: End sem exam
post.message:
Sir,

    Is the end sem open book exam?

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message:
There will be two parts to the exam.  The first part will be a closed book exam.  It will be for about 30 to 45minutes.  After you return this paper, you can attempt the second part of the paper, which will be open book. 

In the mid semester exam, some students wanted to bring in computers to use an e-book version.  I did not permit this, however.  We will follow the same policy in the final exam also: no computers or mobile phones will be allowed in the open book part also.

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message:
Sir,

    What is the weightage of End sem exam? And what is the distribution of closed book and open book exam?

 

Thank you

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message: 30% for closed book part.

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message:
Sir,

Just for a last minute go-through,

can you upload any of the last years' endsems' papers?

It would be very helpful for self-evaluation.

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message:
I am attaching the last year's final exam paper.

Please note that most of the exercise problems at the end of the chapters were asked in some exam or other.  As a result, these problems also will give an idea of what type of questions will be asked.

post.subject: Re: End sem exam
post.message:
The following instructions will be given in Today's exam:

  • No computer/mobile phone is allowed in the exam hall.
  • Part A is closed book, notes, exam.  One can take up to 45 minutes for this part.  Part A has to be completed first.
  • Part B is open book, notes, exam.  
  • No borrowing of anything (pens, pencils, erasers, rulers, calculator, books, notes, etc.) is allowed.  For every borrowing, there is a penalty of 20 marks for borrower and lender.

post.subject: Lab 2 marks uploaded
post.message:
Dear students,

Marks for second lab have beed uploaded.

 

- Ganesh

post.subject: Re: Lab 2 marks uploaded
post.message: I had submitted part A of my second lab well ahead of the deadline, and yet my marks have not been entered. Is the grade for the part B inclusive of part A?

post.subject: Re: Lab 2 marks uploaded
post.message:
same for me as well. my marks for part A of second lab are not uploaded. i have submitted my part A with part B submission as directed.

please clarify on the issue.

post.subject: Re: Lab 2 marks uploaded
post.message: My part A submission has not been graded

post.subject: Re: Lab 2 marks uploaded
post.message:
Dear students,

    Please note that marks entered in the column of Lab 2 - B are the total marks for Lab 2.

Regards,

Ganesh

post.subject: End Sem Paper
post.message:
Sir,

    It would be very helpful if we can see our end sem papers. Can you please arrange for it?

post.subject: Re: End Sem Paper
post.message:
I am at NIT Durgapur now.  I will be returning tomorrow night only.  We can make the papers available on Saturday afternoon.

The students who did not attend the class regularly may not know that all the questions of Part A are based on the classroom discussion, which itself was based on the questions posted in the Moodle forum.  Answers to all the questions of Part A are available on the Moodle page.  All that you have to do is to click my picture from any discussion thread and then click the posts.

post.subject: Re: End Sem Paper
post.message: We want to know whether anyone is interested in coming for this.  If I get any response to this post, we can meet at 4pm in my office.  If I get no response, we will not be available.

post.subject: End sem marks
post.message: dear sir, when we wil get our final marks/grades
